Description: Fragment from just below the rim of wall of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater. A discus thrower, his upper half remaining, standing to right, a chlamys over his left arm, the discus bag in his left hand. He appears as if he has just released the discus (which has a swastika motif) that is hanging in the background.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 101 no. 350 pl. 75)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1025)
